question: Geostationary satellite revolves at?
answers: Height which depends upon its mass
hints: Geostationary satellites are permanently fixed in exactly the same position in the sky
aboutAnswer: Geostationary satellites have the unique property of remaining permanently fixed in exactly the same position in the sky as viewed from any fixed location on Earth, meaning that ground-based antennas do not need to track them but can remain fixed in one direction. Such satellites are often used for communication purposes; a geosynchronous network is a communication network based on communication with or through geosynchronous satellites.
